required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: An Observational Study of Tarceva (Erlotinib) in Elderly Patients With Advanced Non-Small Cell Lung Cancer
clinical_study.official_title: Erlotinib (Tarceva®) in Routine Clinical Practice in Patients With Advanced Non Small Cell Lung Cancer (NSCLC) After Failure of at Least One Prior Chemotherapy Regimen With Focus on the Elderly Patient.

brief_summary.textblock: This prospective observational study will evaluate the efficacy and safety of Tarceva (erlotinib) in elderly patients with advanced non-small cell lung cancer (NSCLC) after failure of at least one prior chemotherapy regimen. Data of patients treated with Tarceva in routine clinical practice will be collected for 1 year.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants Who Were Alive 1 Year After Start of Treatment
primary_outcome.description: Overall survival was defined as the time from the date of first medication to the date of death from any cause. If death was not observed during the study, survival time was censored at the last day of observation (latest at the end of study after one year). Overall percentage of participants who were alive 1 year after study treatment and those based on the factor of age (65-69, 70-74, 75-79, ≥ 80 years) were reported.

secondary_outcome.measure: Median Overall Survival: Age
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From Baseline then every 3 months from Month 3 until death (Maximum follow-up to Month 40)
secondary_outcome.description: Overall Survival was defined as the time from the date of first medication to the date of death from any cause. If death was not observed during the study, survival time was censored at the last day of observation (latest at the end of study after one year). Overall Survival was analyzed by means of Kaplan-Meier Methods. Median survival based on the factor of age (65-69, 70-74, 75-79, ≥80 years) were reported.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Fatigue
Percentage of Participants With Rash
Percentage of Participants With Diarrhea
Percentage of Participants With Rash Based on Severity During the Course of Time
secondary_outcome.description: Severity was categorized as Grades 1, 2, 3, 4 and 5. Grade 1= mild; asymptomatic or mild symptoms; clinical or diagnostic observations only; intervention not indicated. Grade 2= moderate; minimal, local or non-invasive intervention indicated; limiting age-appropriate instrumental activities of daily living (ADL). Grade 3= severe or medically significant but not immediately life-threatening; hospitalization or prolongation of hospitalization indicated; disabling; limiting self care ADL. Grade 4= life-threatening consequences; urgent intervention indicated. Grade 5= death related to adverse event. Only participants that were included in any of the specified categories were reported.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Diarrhea Based on Severity During the Course of Time
secondary_outcome.description: Severity was categorized as Grades 1, 2, 3, 4 and 5. Grade 1= mild; asymptomatic or mild symptoms; clinical or diagnostic observations only; intervention not indicated. Grade 2= moderate; minimal, local or non-invasive intervention indicated; limiting age-appropriate instrumental activities of daily living (ADL). Grade 3= severe or medically significant but not immediately life-threatening; hospitalization or prolongation of hospitalization indicated; disabling; limiting self care ADL. Grade 4= life-threatening consequences; urgent intervention indicated. Grade 5= death related to adverse event. Only participants that were included in any of the specified categories were reported.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Fatigue Based on Severity During the Course of Time
secondary_outcome.description: Severity was categorized as Grades 1, 2, 3, 4 and 5. Grade 1= mild; asymptomatic or mild symptoms; clinical or diagnostic observations only; intervention not indicated. Grade 2= moderate; minimal, local or non-invasive intervention indicated; limiting age-appropriate instrumental activities of daily living (ADL). Grade 3= severe or medically significant but not immediately life-threatening; hospitalization or prolongation of hospitalization indicated; disabling; limiting self care ADL. Grade 4= life-threatening consequences; urgent intervention indicated. Grade 5= death related to adverse event. Only participants that were included in any of the specified categories were reported.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Dose Modifications by Reason
secondary_outcome.description: Dose modification included increase or decreased in the dose of the drug and interrupted dose. Reasons for dose modification included progression, participants' wish, intolerance and others. Only participants that were included in any of the specified categories were reported.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Dose Withdrawals by Reason
secondary_outcome.description: Reasons for dose withdrawals included progression, participants' wish, intolerance, others and not known. Only participants that were included in any of the specified categories were reported.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Cough by Severity
secondary_outcome.description: Severity of cough was categorized as mild, moderate, severe and unknown. Only participants that were included in any of the specified categories in the course of time were reported. Participants with no cough were not included.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Dyspnea by Severity
secondary_outcome.description: Severity of dyspnea was categorized as mild, moderate, severe, life-threatening and unknown. Only participants that were included in any of the specified categories in the course of time were reported. Participants with no dyspnea were not included.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Complete Response (CR), Partial Response (PR) and Stable Disease (SD)
secondary_outcome.description: Response rate was observed during the treatment period according to Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors (RECIST). It consisted of CR, PR, SD and progressive disease (PD). Participants with CR, PR and SD were reported. CR: disappearance of all target lesions (TLs) and non-TLs, with any pathological lymph nodes (whether target or non-target) having a reduction in short axis to less than 10 millimeters (mm). PR: at least a 30 percent (%) decrease in the sum of diameters of TLs, taking as reference the baseline (BL) sum diameters. SD was defined as neither sufficient shrinkage to qualify for PR, nor sufficient increase to qualify for PD, taking as reference the smallest sum diameters while on study. PD: at least 20% increase in the sum of diameters of TLs, taking as a reference the smallest sum on study (this included the BL sum if that was the smallest on study). In addition to the relative increase of 20%, the sum also demonstrated an absolute increase of at least 5 mm.

secondary_outcome.measure: Time to Start of Erlotinib Therapy After End of First Line Therapy
Percentage of Participants With Remission of CR and PR
secondary_outcome.description: Remission was defined as participants with CR or PR. CR: disappearance of all TLs and non-TLs, with any pathological lymph nodes (whether target or non-target) having a reduction in short axis to less than 10 mm. PR: at least a 30% decrease in the sum of diameters of TLs, taking as reference the BL sum diameters.

secondary_outcome.measure: Median Progression Free Survival: Overall
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From Baseline then every 3 months from Month 3 until disease progression (Maximum follow-up to Month 40)
secondary_outcome.description: Progression-free survival time was defined as the time from the date of first medication to the date of disease progression or death from any cause. If neither progression no death was observed during the study, PFS time was censored at the last day of observation. PD was at least a 20% increase in the sum of diameters of TLs, taking as a reference the smallest sum on study (this included the BL sum if that was the smallest on study). In addition to the relative increase of 20%, the sum must also have demonstrated an absolute increase of at least 5 mm.

secondary_outcome.measure: Median Progression Free Survival: Age
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From Baseline then every 3 months from Month 3 until disease progression (Maximum follow-up to Month 40)
secondary_outcome.description: Progression-free survival time was defined as the time from the date of first medication to the date of disease progression or death from any cause. If neither progression nor death was observed during the study, PFS time was censored at the last day of observation. PD was at least a 20% increase in the sum of diameters of TLs, taking as a reference the smallest sum on study (this included the BL sum if that was the smallest on study). In addition to the relative increase of 20%, the sum must also have demonstrated an absolute increase of at least 5 mm. Median progression-free survival based on the factor of age (65-69, 70-74, 75-79, ≥80 years) were reported.

secondary_outcome.measure: Median Progression Free Survival: Gender
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From Baseline then every 3 months from Month 3 until disease progression (Maximum follow-up to Month 40)
secondary_outcome.description: Progression-free survival time was defined as the time from the date of first medication to the date of disease progression or death from any cause. If neither progression nor death was observed during the study, PFS time was censored at the last day of observation. PD was at least a 20% increase in the sum of diameters of TLs, taking as a reference the smallest sum on study (this included the BL sum if that was the smallest on study). In addition to the relative increase of 20%, the sum must also have demonstrated an absolute increase of at least 5 mm. Median progression-free survival based on the factor of gender (male and female) were reported.

secondary_outcome.measure: Median Progression Free Survival: Smoking Status
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From Baseline then every 3 months from Month 3 until disease progression (Maximum follow-up to Month 40)
secondary_outcome.description: Progression-free survival time was defined as the time from the date of first medication to the date of disease progression or death from any cause. If neither progression nor death was observed during the study, PFS time was censored at the last day of observation. PD was at least a 20% increase in the sum of diameters of TLs, taking as a reference the smallest sum on study (this included the BL sum if that was the smallest on study). In addition to the relative increase of 20%, the sum must also have demonstrated an absolute increase of at least 5 mm. Median progression-free survival based on the factor of smoking status (smoker, non-smoker and ex-smoker) were reported.

secondary_outcome.measure: Median Progression Free Survival: Best Response to Prior Chemotherapy
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From Baseline then every 3 months from Month 3 until disease progression (Maximum follow-up to Month 40)
secondary_outcome.description: Progression-free survival time was defined as the time from the date of first medication to the date of disease progression or death from any cause. If neither progression nor death was observed during the study, PFS time was censored at the last day of observation. PD was at least a 20% increase in the sum of diameters of TLs, taking as a reference the smallest sum on study (this included the BL sum if that was the smallest on study). In addition to the relative increase of 20%, the sum must also have demonstrated an absolute increase of at least 5 mm.

secondary_outcome.measure: Median Overall Survival: Overall
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From Baseline then every 3 months from Month 3 until death (Maximum follow-up to Month 40)
secondary_outcome.description: Overall Survival was defined as the time from the date of first medication to the date of death from any cause. If death was not observed during the study, survival time was censored at the last day of observation (latest at the end of study after one year). Overall Survival was analyzed by means of Kaplan-Meier Methods.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From Baseline then every 3 months from Month 3 until death (Maximum follow-up to Month 40)
secondary_outcome.description: Overall Survival was defined as the time from the date of first medication to the date of death from any cause. If death was not observed during the study, survival time was censored at the last day of observation (latest at the end of study after one year). Overall Survival was analyzed by means of Kaplan-Meier Methods. Median survival based on the factor of gender (male and female) were reported.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From Baseline then every 3 months from Month 3 until death (Maximum follow-up to Month 40)

Overall Survival was analyzed by means of Kaplan-Meier Methods. Median survival based on the factor of smoking status (smoker, non-smoker and ex-smoker) were reported.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From Baseline then every 3 months from Month 3 until death (Maximum follow-up to Month 40)

study_pop.textblock: Elderly patients with advanced non-small cell lung cancer after first-line platinum-based chemotherapy

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Adult patients, > 65 years of age
- Locally advanced or metastatic non-small cell lung cancer (Stage IIIb or IV)
- Failure of at least one prior standard platinum-based chemotherapy
Exclusion Criteria:
- Age < 65 years

group.title: Non-small Cell Lung Cancer (NSCLC) Elderly Participants
group.description: Elderly Participants (greater than or equal to [≥] 65 years) with locally advanced or metastatic NSCLC, on erlotinib (Tarceva®) prescribed in accordance with the terms of the marketing authorization, were observed for maximum of 12 months.

drop_withdraw_reason.title: NSCLC grade IV histology not confirmed

baseline.population: Safety Analysis Set (SAF), included participants who received at least one dose of Tarceva®.

group.description: Elderly Participants (≥ 65 years) with locally advanced or metastatic NSCLC, on erlotinib (Tarceva®) prescribed in accordance with the terms of the marketing authorization, were observed for maximum of 12 months.

analysis.groups_desc: Comparison between 70-74 years and 65-69 years was reported. Parameter estimates, standard errors, Wald Chi-Squares, p-values, hazard ratios and confidence limits were based on a univariate Cox regression with factor age.

Comparison between 75-79 years and 65-69 years was reported. Parameter estimates, standard errors, Wald Chi-Squares, p-values, hazard ratios and confidence limits were based on a univariate Cox regression with factor age.

Comparison between ≥ 80 years and 65-69 years was reported. Parameter estimates, standard errors, Wald Chi-Squares, p-values, hazard ratios and confidence limits were based on a univariate Cox regression with factor age.

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants With Complete Response (CR), Partial Response (PR) and Stable Disease (SD)
outcome.description: Response rate was observed during the treatment period according to Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors (RECIST). It consisted of CR, PR, SD and progressive disease (PD). Participants with CR, PR and SD were reported. CR: disappearance of all target lesions (TLs) and non-TLs, with any pathological lymph nodes (whether target or non-target) having a reduction in short axis to less than 10 millimeters (mm). PR: at least a 30 percent (%) decrease in the sum of diameters of TLs, taking as reference the baseline (BL) sum diameters. SD was defined as neither sufficient shrinkage to qualify for PR, nor sufficient increase to qualify for PD, taking as reference the smallest sum diameters while on study. PD: at least 20% increase in the sum of diameters of TLs, taking as a reference the smallest sum on study (this included the BL sum if that was the smallest on study). In addition to the relative increase of 20%, the sum also demonstrated an absolute increase of at least 5 mm.

measure.description: Progression-free survival time was defined as the time from the date of first medication to the date of disease progression or death from any cause. If neither progression nor death was observed during the study, PFS time was censored at the last day of observation. PD was at least a 20% increase in the sum of diameters of TLs, taking as a reference the smallest sum on study (this included the BL sum if that was the smallest on study). In addition to the relative increase of 20%, the sum must also have demonstrated an absolute increase of at least 5 mm. Median progression-free survival based on the factor of age (65-69, 70-74, 75-79, ≥80 years) were reported.

analysis.groups_desc: Comparison between 70-74 years and 65-69 years was reported. Parameter estimates, standard errors, Wald Chi-Squares, p-values, hazard ratios and confidence limits were based on a univariate Cox regression with factor age.

Comparison between 75-79 years and 65-69 years was reported. Parameter estimates, standard errors, Wald Chi-Squares, p-values, hazard ratios and confidence limits were based on a univariate Cox regression with factor age.

Comparison between ≥ 80 years and 65-69 years was reported. Parameter estimates, standard errors, Wald Chi-Squares, p-values, hazard ratios and confidence limits were based on a univariate Cox regression with factor age.

outcome.title: Median Progression Free Survival: Gender
outcome.description: Progression-free survival time was defined as the time from the date of first medication to the date of disease progression or death from any cause. If neither progression nor death was observed during the study, PFS time was censored at the last day of observation. PD was at least a 20% increase in the sum of diameters of TLs, taking as a reference the smallest sum on study (this included the BL sum if that was the smallest on study). In addition to the relative increase of 20%, the sum must also have demonstrated an absolute increase of at least 5 mm. Median progression-free survival based on the factor of gender (male and female) were reported.
outcome.time_frame: From Baseline then every 3 months from Month 3 until disease progression (Maximum follow-up to Month 40)

group.title: NSCLC Elderly Participants
group.description: Elderly Participants (≥ 65 years) with locally advanced or metastatic NSCLC, on erlotinib (Tarceva®) prescribed in accordance with the terms of the marketing authorization, were observed for maximum of 12 months.

measure.title: Median Progression Free Survival: Gender
measure.description: Progression-free survival time was defined as the time from the date of first medication to the date of disease progression or death from any cause. If neither progression nor death was observed during the study, PFS time was censored at the last day of observation. PD was at least a 20% increase in the sum of diameters of TLs, taking as a reference the smallest sum on study (this included the BL sum if that was the smallest on study). In addition to the relative increase of 20%, the sum must also have demonstrated an absolute increase of at least 5 mm. Median progression-free survival based on the factor of gender (male and female) were reported.

analysis.groups_desc: Comparison between female and male was reported. Parameter estimates, standard errors, Wald Chi-Squares, p-values, hazard ratios and confidence limits were based on a univariate Cox regression with factor gender.

outcome.title: Median Progression Free Survival: Smoking Status
outcome.description: Progression-free survival time was defined as the time from the date of first medication to the date of disease progression or death from any cause. If neither progression nor death was observed during the study, PFS time was censored at the last day of observation. PD was at least a 20% increase in the sum of diameters of TLs, taking as a reference the smallest sum on study (this included the BL sum if that was the smallest on study). In addition to the relative increase of 20%, the sum must also have demonstrated an absolute increase of at least 5 mm. Median progression-free survival based on the factor of smoking status (smoker, non-smoker and ex-smoker) were reported.
outcome.time_frame: From Baseline then every 3 months from Month 3 until disease progression (Maximum follow-up to Month 40)

group.title: NSCLC Elderly Participants
group.description: Elderly Participants (≥ 65 years) with locally advanced or metastatic NSCLC, on erlotinib (Tarceva®) prescribed in accordance with the terms of the marketing authorization, were observed for maximum of 12 months.

In addition to the relative increase of 20%, the sum must also have demonstrated an absolute increase of at least 5 mm. Median progression-free survival based on the factor of smoking status (smoker, non-smoker and ex-smoker) were reported.

outcome.title: Median Progression Free Survival: Best Response to Prior Chemotherapy
outcome.description: Progression-free survival time was defined as the time from the date of first medication to the date of disease progression or death from any cause. If neither progression nor death was observed during the study, PFS time was censored at the last day of observation. PD was at least a 20% increase in the sum of diameters of TLs, taking as a reference the smallest sum on study (this included the BL sum if that was the smallest on study). In addition to the relative increase of 20%, the sum must also have demonstrated an absolute increase of at least 5 mm.
outcome.time_frame: From Baseline then every 3 months from Month 3 until disease progression (Maximum follow-up to Month 40)
outcome.population: Data for best response to prior chemotherapy could not be collected, as it was not recorded in the Case Report Form (CRF), hence, the analysis could not be performed.

group.title: NSCLC Elderly Participants
group.description: Elderly Participants (≥ 65 years) with locally advanced or metastatic NSCLC, on erlotinib (Tarceva®) prescribed in accordance with the terms of the marketing authorization, were observed for maximum of 12 months.

measure.title: Median Progression Free Survival: Best Response to Prior Chemotherapy
measure.description: Progression-free survival time was defined as the time from the date of first medication to the date of disease progression or death from any cause. If neither progression nor death was observed during the study, PFS time was censored at the last day of observation. PD was at least a 20% increase in the sum of diameters of TLs, taking as a reference the smallest sum on study (this included the BL sum if that was the smallest on study). measure.population: Data for best response to prior chemotherapy could not be collected, as it was not recorded in the Case Report Form (CRF), hence, the analysis could not be performed.

outcome.title: Median Overall Survival: Overall
outcome.description: Overall Survival was defined as the time from the date of first medication to the date of death from any cause. If death was not observed during the study, survival time was censored at the last day of observation (latest at the end of study after one year). Overall Survival was analyzed by means of Kaplan-Meier Methods.
outcome.time_frame: From Baseline then every 3 months from Month 3 until death (Maximum follow-up to Month 40)

group.title: NSCLC Elderly Participants
group.description: Elderly Participants (≥ 65 years) with locally advanced or metastatic NSCLC, on erlotinib (Tarceva®) prescribed in accordance with the terms of the marketing authorization, were observed for maximum of 12 months.

category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The Study being conducted under this Agreement is part of the Overall Study. Investigator is free to publish in reputable journals or to present at professional conferences the results of the Study, but only after the first publication or presentation that involves the Overall Study. The Sponsor may request that Confidential Information be deleted and/or the publication be postponed in order to protect the Sponsor’s intellectual property rights.
